rComments: Professor Perry's emphasis is paganism and atheism.  Therefore, her course is very narrowly structured to promote same.  Frankly,  the class was visually, morally, and intellectually offensive.  I actually felt sorry for her for having viewed so many negatively graphic photos.

If you take Katie for a big lecture class she might come across as unlikeable but the sweetest most helpful teachers I've had. She cares about her students not just art-wise but about how they are doing emotionallyphysically. I love her critiques as well - her feedback is awesome and she fosters a community with the class. Take her class!!!

Art 80D: Boring an unorganized. Never gave dates for small section assignments.  Shows you a bunch of pictures that she claims are "good" and expects you to do the same in this into class.  Photos are expected to revel some sort of meaning, when the only reason I took this class was to learn how to work a camera.  They expect professional Pictures.

Katy is a really great teacher, I had her twice for Intro to Photography and also a 10 series class. Both times, she was very nice and was there whenever you had questions or concerns about the class. Her classes are pretty fun, and her TA's are all really cool. Class isn't hard, but you still learn a lot of cool things.
